catalogue_raissonne: Meder 71 c/d (with the scratches but before the one toward the mouth); Bartsch 78 (vol. 7, p. 92); Heller 831; Dodgson 13; Panofsky 185
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: rear 3/4 view of female figure standing on a ball; small scarf blowing from her back down towards her knee; figure leans on a staff, holds a thistle-like plant in PR hand
markings: watermark: fragment of a cross (probably High Crown); circular stamp on verso, LL, unidentified
provenance: [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York; sold November 10, 1987, to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: The Little Fortune
